My Egyptian friend Ken has been having a crush on this girl named Jo for seven years but Jo has a boyfriend. His friend said "I don't blame you. She's quite attractive" But he's beginning to realise he has no place in her scheme of things. He's just being a doormat so I told him to forget her. She's just not worth it. His brother said "You would be better off without her" He works as a accounting manager at Hilton but if he takes the job in big 4 he'll be four thousand dollars a month better off but he's still better off now than he was two years ago when he was working below everybody else in the department. He thinks a junior accountant position is beneath him. If he hadn't taken the CPA exam two years ago he wouldn't be working as a manager now. He's a science fiction fan. He said "If scientists really would invent a starship I would quit m job and spend the rest of my life roaming the universe" Recently his sister married her childhood sweetheart. Her mother felt she was marrying beneath her though. Her uncle feels her husband is beneath her too. She enjoys socialising with the better off. Two months ago Ken was away on a business trip to Hokkaido. I said "If you should go there again can you get me this pack of chocolate?" Ken is a computer expert. His cousin has to write a report which is due on Tuesday but she's having problems with her computer. If Ken will go and fix her computer she'll be so thankful for his help. She also has an exam next Monday so she's better off revising at home this weekend. Ken is a kickboxing fan. His favourite fighter Dan won his retirement fight recently. He's eternally grateful to his coaches and thankful that he got a job as a colour commentator after he retired from the sport. All the fans want to see Fred versus Randy. If he would sign the contract with the organisation Dana will make the fight happen. Ken's elder brother works as a concierge in a hotel. Ken said "If it will make you happy I'll come to stay for a night as company for you while your colleagues are away." He gave a house party last week. His television is cheap and nasty. As many of us wanted to watch the news so I said "If I could turn the television on please" He then said "sure. If you would switch to the news channel" I saw Joey live twice. For her first concert we were late. I said "Look at the time. The concert will have started" It was quarter past eight. The concert would have started by then. My friend Jason has a job interview next week. I said "I'm rooting for you. I'm there for you." My brother too said "I support you. It's gonna be ok. I've got your back." His girlfriend has geography exams at university next month so she's busy with revision. I said "You're almost there. I've got your back" My brother said "You got this. I believe in you." When his professor Dr. Chan was tutoring her he said "That's coming along nicely. You're on the right track now. Keep it up. You're learning fast. You've almost mastered that" Her tutor also said "Now you've got the hang of it. You're doing fine. You're getting better every day. Keep up the good work" By next century scientists will have invented a starship. By the way I need to ask Professor Chan something so I'm going to wait outside the lecture room at six. He'll have finished his lecture.
